author: Ground AI
title: Ground News - Blackpool Tower fire: Fire crews called to iconic landmark
text:
Left Center Right
Bias Insights
Bias Insights Lancashire Police have confirmed that the " fire " at Blackpool Tower was actually orange netting flapping in the wind. Lancashire Fire and Rescue Service responded to reports of a fire and evacuated people from the scene. The incident at Blackpool Tower was caused by orange netting flapping in the wind, as confirmed by Lancashire Police and Fire and Rescue Service.
Insights by Ground AI
Does this summary seem wrong? Share menu More

6 hours ago · London, United Kingdom Read Full Article The Independent Lean Left High Factuality Individual: Evgeny Lebedev Blackpool Tower: Police discover ‘fire’ is in fact orange netting A fire appeared to break out at Blackpool Tower on Thursday 28 December, with emergency services called to the attraction. Blackpool Police have since confirmed that the flames seen at the top of the tower are in fact orange netting, and that a man has been arrested for breach of the peace. Chief Superintendent Karen Edwards said: “Our helicopter has flown over the tower and there is no fire. We can confirm what can be seen is orange netting.” I…
